text:
Colleges and Universities: Columbia University--The sphere on the south side of W. 116th Street between Amsterdam Avenue and Broadway. South Field forms the background.

October 1914

George L. Balgue
title: Colleges and Universities - Columbia University.

text:
(1) Columbia University: West 116th Street, between Amsterdam Ave., and Broadway. This view taken from in front of The Library (extreme right), shows the rotunda of Earl Hall, with the School of Mines on the left.

June 28, 1919.

Walter L. Bogert.

(2) The same.

September 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Colleges and Universities - Columbia University.

text:
(1) Columbia University, West 116th Street, north side, between Broadway and Amsterdam Ave. This view shows from left to right, the Library, St. Paul's Chapel, College Hall and the Philosophy Buildings.

June 1923.

Walter L. Bogert.

(2) A more complete view of the Library.

September 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) A limited view showing the colonnaded entrance.

September 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Colleges and Universities - Columbia University.

title: Colleges and Universities - Columbia University.

text:
116th Street, south side, west from but not including Amsterdam Ave., to but not including Broadway. Columbia University campus building's also shown.

July 31, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Columbia University: A view westward, and showing the southern sides of College Hall and The Library. In the background appears a portion of the School of Mines. 1936.

Walter L. Bogert.

(2) The same. 1936.

Walter L. Bogert.

(3) The same, from a different angle, and also showing on the left, the School for Business. 1936.

Walter L. Bogert.

(4) A view mainly of College Hall. The view is eastward, and shows the Philosophy Building with Johnson Hall across Amsterdam Ave. 1936.

Walter L. Bogert.
title: Colleges and Universities - Columbia University - [College Hall.]

text:
(1) Columbia University: A view westward, and showing the southern sides of College Hall and The Library. In the background appears a portion of the School of Mines. 1936.

Walter L. Bogert.

(2) The same. 1936.

Walter L. Bogert.

(3) The same, from a different angle, and also showing on the left, the School for Business. 1936.

Walter L. Bogert.

(4) A view mainly of College Hall. The view is eastward, and shows the Philosophy Building with Johnson Hall across Amsterdam Ave. 1936.

Walter L. Bogert.
title: Colleges and Universities - Columbia University - [College Hall.]

text:
(1) Columbia University: A view of Kent Hall, (N.W. corner of Amsterdam Ave., at West 116th Street). Also shown across 116th (right), is Hamilton Hall (S.W. corner). The building on the left partially shown, is the Philosophy Building. 1936.

Walter L. Bogert.

(2) Another view of Kent Hall, as seen looking eastward on West 116th Street. On the right appears a portion of Hamilton Hall which is on the S.W. corner.

September 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Colleges and Universities - Columbia University.

text:

(2) Another view of Kent Hall, as seen looking eastward on West 116th Street. On the right appears a portion of Hamilton Hall which is on the S.W. corner.

September 3, 1937.

text:
1-116th Street, north side, between Amsterdam and Broadway, showing the Seth Low Library at Columbia University.
2--a distant view of the Library.
